text: Good day to you and welcome to the weather forecast from Elight.
It's just the beginning of the summer,
but the North of the country had to suffer from the highest temperatures ever recorded last week.
People living in this area were certainly annoyed and irritated
by the hot weather caused by high temperature and humidity.
And in Hanoi, the capital,
the temperature even peaked at 42 degrees celsius at noon
in the first day of the heat-wave.
However, this week, with the cold front from the Northern part now moving South,
the temperature for the whole country is expected to be 4 degrees celsius lower than last week.
To go into more detail,
the average temperature in Hanoi will be 32 degrees celsius
and the temperature during daytime may reach highs of 36 degrees celsius.
It will be cloudy and there is a chance of thunderstorms during the day.
As usual,
the North central coast will experience the highest temperature in the country
with the temperature raging from 27 to 39 degrees celsius.
The local people should be so careful
because there will be hailstorms in the middle of the week.
Over the weekend,
it's expected to be cooler and windy
with gentle sunlight.
On the South central coast,
the temperature will hover around 34 degrees celsius.
Summer showers can happen at anytime during the day,
so you should bring an umbrella or a raincoat with you just in case
Moving to the South, the weather is expected to be really mild
with bright skies and with the highs of around 32 degrees celsius.
Summer showers will happen every evening
and it will cool things off a bit.
So it's an ideal destination for anyone who wants to get away from the extreme heat up North.
And this is the end of the weather forecast from Elight.
Please enjoy your week and stay dry.
